title: Providing an Order of Succession Within the Office of Management and Budget

enrichment.summary: This executive order sets a specific line of succession for who will act as Director of the Office of Management and Budget if both the Director and Deputy Director are unable to serve. It also revokes the previous order on succession within this office and clarifies that acting Directors must meet eligibility requirements under existing law.
potential_concerns: Succession may be disrupted if multiple positions listed are filled by acting officials simultaneously, limiting the pool of eligible successors.
The Presidentâ€™s discretion to depart from the order could cause uncertainty or politicization in succession decisions.
Eligibility restrictions under the Federal Vacancies Reform Act may limit available acting Directors during unforeseen circumstances.
Lack of clarity on implementation protocols might cause operational delays during leadership transitions.
Revoking the previous succession order may create transitional ambiguity if proper communication is not ensured.
